titleStmt.title: R. V. Pollitt et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10159

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned petitioners Respectfully solict your Execllncy B. Magoffin Govenor of Kentucky to remit the fine aganst John Baker for Eleven dollars for a Breach of the Peace in franklin on the 2 day of February 1861 at Peaks Mill your petition father pray for all proper releaf in the case

J T. Graham
W W. Graham
William I. Jewett
William C. Scott
Graves Hancock
R H Pollett
John Perry
James His H Graham
James Sullivan Juror
Reney L Wise
E F Bacon
W Satterwhite
Edward dougherty
F. Satterwite Juror
John T Long
J O sebree
S K Davidson
E D Hensley
C M Christopher
J. W. Winter
M. D. Petty
Will H Christopher
George Fleming
Lucian Hawkins
M R Pierce
F. J. Little
C. T. Tyler
Harvey Scott
G Breden
Charles Pierce
Jno M Harlan
Jno Rodman
H. R. miller
Th N Lindsey
W I. Buffin
W. S. Dehoney
Geo. W. Robb

Franklin Ct J. P.
$11. } Breach
John Baker
Respite 12 mo
B. M
Issd Feby 18 1861
